title: Remove JSON API, convert /search to HTML-only
description:
Architectural shift: convert the app from JSON API to server-rendered HTML only.

## Context
The original plan was a JSON API + separate frontend. New direction is Jinja2+HTMX server-rendered HTML as the only client.

## Scope
- Remove JSON response from POST /search endpoint
- Convert /search to return HTML (TemplateResponse)
- Remove SearchResponse as API response model (keep internally if useful)
- Keep /health, /metrics, /bulk-load as-is (operational endpoints)

## Out of Scope
- Actual search UI implementation (separate ticket)
- OpenAPI docs decision (can revisit later)

## Dependencies
- Requires dishcovery-dx1 (Jinja2+HTMX basic setup) to be completed first
acceptance_criteria:
- POST /search returns HTML instead of JSON
- /health returns JSON (unchanged)
- /metrics returns Prometheus format (unchanged)
- /bulk-load returns JSON (unchanged)
- No regressions to Elasticsearch query logic

title: Integrate Jinja2+HTMX basic setup
description:
Add Jinja2 templating and HTMX to the FastAPI application for server-side rendered frontend.

## Scope
- Add jinja2 dependency to pyproject.toml
- Create api/templates/ directory structure
- Create api/static/ directory with HTMX library
- Configure StaticFiles and Jinja2Templates in main.py
- Add a basic index route that renders a template

## Out of Scope
- Full search UI implementation
- CSS framework selection
- Recipe display templates
acceptance_criteria:
- Jinja2 templates render successfully from /
- HTMX library is served from /static/
- Templates directory structure exists
- No regressions to existing API endpoints

title: Add basic search input with debounced HTMX request
description:
Add a minimal search UI that queries Elasticsearch for recipe titles.

## Behavior
- Simple text input on the index page
- Fires POST /search after 300ms debounce (hx-trigger="keyup changed delay:300ms")
- No submit button needed
- Results display as basic unstyled HTML list of recipe titles
- Show total count (e.g., "Found 6,037 recipes")
- Handle empty/no results state

## Technical
- Form sends query via standard form encoding
- /search endpoint accepts form data and returns HTML fragment
- HTMX swaps results into target div

## Out of Scope
- Styling/CSS
- Filters (cuisine, dietary, time, etc.)
- Pagination
- Recipe detail view

## Dependencies
- Requires dishcovery-dx1 (Jinja2+HTMX basic setup)
- Requires dishcovery-cir (JSON to HTML conversion)
acceptance_criteria:
- User can type in search input
- Results appear automatically after 300ms pause in typing
- Recipe titles are displayed in a list
- Total count is shown
- Empty query shows all recipes (or appropriate default)
- No results state is handled
